                         throws java.io.IOException
Encoding of the octet string type. The encoding is a sequence of eight bits.

encodeAsBoolean

public void encodeAsBoolean(boolean value,
                            TypeInformation typeInformation)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Encoding of the boolean type. Encoding is a single bit Note: There is no difference between the UNALIGNED and the ALIGNED variant.

Specified by:
encodeAsBoolean in interface ASN1Encoder
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
"X.691-0207 11"

encodeAsObjectIdentifier

public void encodeAsObjectIdentifier(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> value,
                                     TypeInformation typeInformation)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Encoding of the ObjectIdentifier type. Note: The ObjectIdentifier type is encoded using the content octets of a BER preceeded by a length determinant.

Specified by:
encodeAsObjectIdentifier in interface ASN1Encoder
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
"X.691-0207 23", "X.690-0207 8.19"

encodeAsVisibleString

public void encodeAsVisibleString(java.lang.String value,
                                  TypeInformation typeInformation)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Encoding of the restricted character string type VisibleString. The mapping of characters to encodable values follows the "International Register of Coded Character Sets" no. 6 (ISO 646, USA Version X3.4 - 1968) + SPACE. Note: one unconstrained character is encoded on 7 bits. But the actual amount of bits used is 8 bits since the amount of bits used in the ALIGNED variant has to be a power of two.

Specified by:
encodeAsVisibleString in interface ASN1Encoder
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
"X.691-0207 27", "X.680-0207 37.1", ISO Character Set Table 006

encodeAsIA5String

public void encodeAsIA5String(java.lang.String value,
                              TypeInformation typeInformation)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Encoding of the restricted character string type IA5String. The mapping of characters to encodable values follows the "International Register of Coded Character Sets" no. 1 + 6 (ISO 646, USA Version X3.4 - 1968) + SPACE + DELETE.

Specified by:
encodeAsIA5String in interface ASN1Encoder
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
"X.691-0207 27", "X.680-0207 37.1", ISO Character Set Table 001, ISO Character Set Table 006

Encoding of the restricted character string type PrintableString. The mapping of characters to encodable values follows the specification X.680-0207 37.4 Table 8.

encodeAsChoice

public <T> void encodeAsChoice(java.util.List<TypeEncoder> componentEncoderList,
                               TypeInformation typeInformation)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Encoding of the choice type Note: Encoding of choice types are not affected by PER-visible constraints. TODO: If one component is an untagged CHOICE then the component will adopt the tag of the component with the smallest tag in the "RootAlternativeTypeList" of the CHOICE type.

Specified by:
encodeAsChoice in interface ASN1Encoder
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
"X.691-0207 22"
